classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D2, Lower-Division E, and GE Elective. Upper-Division C should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Upper-Division C cannot be fulfilled with Ethnic Studies courses. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Any Free Elective course can go here.

Some Free Electives may need to be 300-400 level to ensure completion of required minimum of 60 units upper division. If a General Education (GE) course is used to satisfy a Major or Support requirement, additional units of Free Electives may be needed to complete the total units required for the degree. Consult college advisor for additional information.

ES Survey Electives: Select 2 courses from ES252, ES253, ES254, ES255, or ES256.

Any Approved Elective course can go here.

Approved Electives can be selected from any unused ES course or from the Approved Electives list. Courses not on the Approved Electives list may still be selected, but are subject to department approval. A minimum of 8 units of Approved Electives must be at the 300-400 level. Be aware that some courses on this list may have prerequisites and that these prerequisites may need to be taken as Free Electives. Consultation with advisor is recommended prior to selecting electives; bear in mind your selections may impact pursuit of post-baccalaureate studies and/or goals. See catalog for course options.
